template.description: This template fetches a token from a given URL and stores it in the DistributedMapCache. The token can then be fetched from the cache whenever required (if the token is in its TTL) instead of making the API call every time. Date : 03-12-2018 Author : Prajakta Kumbhojkar (212712077)
template.name: Token_Utility_Using_DistributedMapCache

processGroups.comments: Using DistributedMapCache to store an access token for future use.

labels.label:
PutDistributedMapCache_StoreAccessToken :
This stores the access token in the DistributedMapCache. The DistributedMapCacheClientService is used in this processor. For this controller service, a DistributedMapCacheServer controller service also needs to be configured on the same port as the DistributedMapCacheClientService.

Extract access_token from JSON :
This extracts the value of the access token from the response JSON. If the access token is returned as response body (not in JSON), ExtractText processor can be used in its place.

NOTE -
LogAttribute :
The LogAttribute processors signify a logical termination. If further processing is required, other processors may be used in their place.

GetAccessToken :
Makes the API call to get the value of access token. All other (HTTP or otherwise) parameters required for the API call can be set here.

CreateRequestBody :
Configure as the content of the flowfile, the username and password (and other details, if any) required for making the API call to get the access token.

FetchDistributedMapCache_GetAccessToken :
This fetches the access token from the DistributedMapCache. The same DistributedMapCacheClientService that is used in the PutDistributedMapCache processor is used in this processor.

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute
